read_query.name: read_query
read_query.description: Execute a SELECT query on the SQLite database

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: SELECT SQL query to execute

write_query.name: write_query
write_query.description: Execute an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE query on the SQLite database

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: SQL query to execute

create_table.name: create_table
create_table.description: Create a new table in the SQLite database

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: CREATE TABLE SQL statement

list_tables.name: list_tables
list_tables.description: List all tables in the SQLite database

describe_table.name: describe_table
describe_table.description: Get the schema information for a specific table

arguments.name: table_name
arguments.description: Name of the table to describe

append_insight.name: append_insight
append_insight.description: Add a business insight to the memo

arguments.name: insight
arguments.description: Business insight discovered from data analysis

get_stories.name: get_stories
get_stories.description: Get stories from Hacker News. The options are `top`, `new`, `ask_hn`, `show_hn` for types of stories. This doesn't include the comments. Use `get_story_info` to get the comments.

arguments.name: story_type
arguments.description: Type of stories to get, one of: `top`, `new`, `ask_hn`, `show_hn`

arguments.name: num_stories
arguments.description: Number of stories to get

get_user_info.name: get_user_info
get_user_info.description: Get user info from Hacker News, including the stories they've submitted

arguments.name: user_name
arguments.description: Username of the user

arguments.name: num_stories
arguments.description: Number of stories to get, defaults to 10

search_stories.name: search_stories
search_stories.description: Search stories from Hacker News. It is generally recommended to use simpler queries to get a broader set of results (less than 5 words). Very targetted queries may not return any results.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: Search query

arguments.name: search_by_date
arguments.description: Search by date, defaults to False. If this is False, then we search by relevance, then points, then number of comments.

arguments.name: num_results
arguments.description: Number of results to get, defaults to 10

get_story_info.name: get_story_info
get_story_info.description: Get detailed story info from Hacker News, including the comments

arguments.name: story_id
arguments.description: Story ID

fetch_url.name: fetch_url
fetch_url.description: Retrieve web page content from a specified URL

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: URL to fetch

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: Page loading timeout in milliseconds, default is 30000 (30 seconds)

arguments.name: waitUntil
arguments.description: Specifies when navigation is considered complete, options: 'load', 'domcontentloaded', 'networkidle', 'commit', default is 'load'

arguments.name: extractContent
arguments.description: Whether to intelligently extract the main content, default is true

arguments.name: maxLength
arguments.description: Maximum length of returned content (in characters), default is no limit

arguments.name: returnHtml
arguments.description: Whether to return HTML content instead of Markdown, default is false

arguments.name: waitForNavigation
arguments.description: Whether to wait for additional navigation after initial page load (useful for sites with anti-bot verification), default is false

arguments.name: navigationTimeout
arguments.description: Maximum time to wait for additional navigation in milliseconds, default is 10000 (10 seconds)

arguments.name: disableMedia
arguments.description: Whether to disable media resources (images, stylesheets, fonts, media), default is true

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Whether to enable debug mode (showing browser window), overrides the --debug command line flag if specified

fetch_urls.name: fetch_urls
fetch_urls.description: Retrieve web page content from multiple specified URLs

arguments.name: urls
arguments.description: Array of URLs to fetch

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: Page loading timeout in milliseconds, default is 30000 (30 seconds)

arguments.name: waitUntil
arguments.description: Specifies when navigation is considered complete, options: 'load', 'domcontentloaded', 'networkidle', 'commit', default is 'load'

arguments.name: extractContent
arguments.description: Whether to intelligently extract the main content, default is true

arguments.name: maxLength
arguments.description: Maximum length of returned content (in characters), default is no limit

arguments.name: returnHtml
arguments.description: Whether to return HTML content instead of Markdown, default is false

arguments.name: waitForNavigation
arguments.description: Whether to wait for additional navigation after initial page load (useful for sites with anti-bot verification), default is false

arguments.name: navigationTimeout
arguments.description: Maximum time to wait for additional navigation in milliseconds, default is 10000 (10 seconds)

arguments.name: disableMedia
arguments.description: Whether to disable media resources (images, stylesheets, fonts, media), default is true

arguments.name: debug
arguments.description: Whether to enable debug mode (showing browser window), overrides the --debug command line flag if specified
